<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good Thursday morning. </strong>We’re living through a once-in-a-generation event, and like you, we’ve been finding it difficult to make sense of it all. That’s why, on our <em>Business Casual</em> podcast, host Kinsey Grant has been talking to and learning from the smartest people around.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In today’s episode, she spoke with a pretty smart guy: Mark Cuban, the owner of the Dallas Mavericks and (if we can say this) our favorite shark on <em>Shark Tank</em>. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/senate-passes-2-trillion-stimulus-bill?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Third Time’s the $6 Trillion Charm
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Capitol Hill" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNjAvY2FwaXRvbF9oaWxsLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>ALEX EDELMAN/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After two false starts and some last-minute political squabbling, the Senate passed a $2 trillion economic relief package late last night. Combined with <span>Fed intervention</span>, total stimulus measures add up to $6 trillion, according to White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Write down what you did today </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This is a historic moment; the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-administration-senate-democrats-said-to-reach-stimulus-bill-deal-11585113371?mod=hp_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">largest stimulus measure ever approved by Congress</a> could pass. This bill’s price tag is <span>more than 30% larger than</span> that of the legislation passed in the aftermath of the 2008 financial crisis. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let's break down the highlights: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">$301 billion of free money. </strong>Many Americans will receive direct payments of up to $1,200, plus $500 per child. The payments phase out at individuals making more than $99,000 and couples making more than $198,000. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">$250 billion for expanded unemployment insurance. </strong>Those who qualify for unemployment support will receive, on average, <span>expanded unemployment benefits for up to four months</span> plus $600/week in addition to state benefits (this was the subject of the squabbling). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">$117 billion for hospitals and veterans' health care. </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">$349 billion in loans to small businesses. </strong>What you spend on payroll, utilities, or rent doesn't have to be repaid. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">$500 billion in loans, loan guarantees, or investments </strong>available for companies, municipalities, and states that've been harmed. $61 billion is earmarked for loans<span> and direct cash assistance</span> to airlines—with strings attached like caps on executive pay and requirements that they maintain payroll. Another $17 billion is reserved for companies critical to national security. Lawmakers said that could apply to any number of firms...but we’re thinking of one planemaker that rhymes with “Froeing.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>All businesses that receive government loans are subject to restrictions like a ban on stock buybacks for the duration of the loan plus one year after. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">As for student loans...</strong>most Americans with federal student loans won't need to make monthly payments through Sept. 30, with no interest accruing. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The urgent nature of this crisis means the legislation is focused on what <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/25/business/2-trillion-stimulus-coronavirus-bill.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the NYT calls</a> “survival payments.” The goal is to keep people employed and spending cash, as well as to extend a life raft to floundering companies. But if the coronavirus outbreak in the U.S. keeps chugging into the summer, even more government injections will probably be needed.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/developing-nations-particularly-susceptible-coronavirus-pandemic?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Developing Countries Face Uphill Climb Against COVID-19
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Venezuelan hair cut " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTMvdmVuZXp1ZWxhbl9oYWlyX2N1dC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getting a haircut in the Petare slum of Caracas, Venezuela. Carlos Becerra/Getty Images.</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The coronavirus pandemic has wrecked economies and buckled healthcare systems in the wealthiest nations in the world. Now, the virus is starting to spread across the world’s poorest countries, and the outlook is even more dire. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Social distancing: </strong>Nearly 60% of Africa’s urban residents live in <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-is-advancing-on-poor-nations-and-the-prognosis-is-troubling-11585149183?mod=hp_lead_pos10&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">crowded slums</a>, where basic sanitation practices like hand-washing aren’t available even in non-pandemic times. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Testing: </strong>Many developing countries don’t have nearly enough testing capacity to determine whether they even have an outbreak. Indonesia (pop. ~273 million) tested just 7.4 people per million as of March 20, per <a href="https://ourworldindata.org/covid-testing?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Our World in Data</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Informal economies: </strong>The vast majority of Indian workers participate in an “<a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/25/coronavirus-india-lockdown-to-disproportionately-hurt-informal-sector.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">informal</a>” economy composed of food vendors, taxi drivers, and other sidewalk businesses. As the country of 1.3+ billion goes into lockdown mode for 21 days, <span>potential government handouts will be those workers' only source of income.</span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Formal economies: </strong>As investors duck for cover in U.S. government bonds, they’re <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/24/business/coronavirus-per-country-pandemic.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pulling money</a> from emerging markets like South Africa and Brazil at the fastest pace on record.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/big-techs-attempts-help-covid-response-revamp-image?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When Was the Last Time You Read About Big Tech?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt=""It's been 84 years" GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=289 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/355/it_s_been_84_years_gif.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="" It's been 84 years" GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/355/it_s_been_84_years_gif.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Or at least it feels that long. As the world focuses on more pressing issues, Big Tech has gotten a break as D.C.'s punching bag—and with that a possible <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-big-tech/coronavirus-pandemic-hands-big-tech-a-chance-to-burnish-its-image-idUSKBN21442S?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">image refresh</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The reasoning? </strong>There’s little time to talk monopolistic behavior or data privacy in the midst of a global health crisis and likely recession. Plus, Big Tech has been busy <a href="http://wsj.com/articles/techs-next-disruption-target-the-coronavirus-11585147772?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disrupting disease</a>:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Alphabet sicced its DeepMind AI arm on finding a COVID-19 vaccine.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Facebook is donating 720,000 masks to health workers and giving $100 million in cash and ad credits to small businesses.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Cloud giants Amazon, Google, and Microsoft are joining President Trump’s COVID-19 High Performance Computing Consortium.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But...there’s a but.</strong> Some wonder if Big Tech can <a href="https://www.statnews.com/2020/03/25/tech-companies-coronavirus-response/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scale efforts</a> beyond the West Coast fast enough, especially as their services (connecting people on the internet, peddling Lysol wipes, feeding you dog videos) are more in demand now than ever. Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg may have put it best to the NYT: “We’re just trying to <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/24/technology/virus-facebook-usage-traffic.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">keep the lights on</a> over here.”</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AGRICULTURE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/coronavirus-affecting-farmers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Caught Between a Farm and a Hard Place
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A raincloud over a farm " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTkvZmFybV9yYWluY2xvdWQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you thought times were tough without a medium-rare-no-onions burger from your favorite local restaurant, consider the <a href="https://www.baltimoresun.com/coronavirus/bs-md-farmers-coronavirus-20200320-7yajictydjg27j6zgphqw32o2i-story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">situation of farmers</a> supplying the lettuce, tomatoes, and everything else that goes into that meal.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">U.S. farmers are facing a strange set of circumstances. </strong><span>On one hand, many supply one of the few “essential” businesses still open: grocery stores. But on the other, farms’ alternate buyers, restaurants, are </span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/24/dining/restaurant-suppliers-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dramatically scaling back</a> their purchasing<span>.</span></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The main issue: Small farms looking to pivot from dwindling restaurant business → booming grocery business lack the scale of competitors like Tyson or ConAgra.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Land-based farm operations <a href="https://www.seattletimes.com/life/food-drink/can-seattles-farmers-markets-remain-open-through-the-stay-at-home-period/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rely on early spring income</a> to fund seed purchases and upcoming planting, meaning a slowdown today hamstrings tomorrow's crop. All in all, the coronavirus pandemic could cost local and regional food systems $689 million in lost sales from March to May.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One creative workaround: </strong>Some farmers are playing Amazon Fresh, <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-farmers/who-needs-instacart-u-s-farmers-expand-food-deliveries-during-coronavirus-outbreak-idUSKBN21C1D3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Reuters reports</a>. In areas short on grocery delivery services but not on social distancing, small farms have begun home deliveries to meet the demand of hungry hermits wary of picked-over grocery stores.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GENERAL BIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/snapshot-biz-world-coronavirus-pandemic?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
For the History Books
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="coronavirus image" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDYvY29yb25hdmlydXNfaW1hZ2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A snapshot of the business world on March 26, 2020:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bauer, </strong>the hockey equipment manufacturer, is making <a href="https://www.espn.com/nhl/story/_/id/28952782/bauer-switches-making-hockey-equipment-medical-gear?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">medical shields</a> for hospital workers. Its Quebec plant already has orders for more than 100,000 units across Canada.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">SpaceX </strong>is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/25/spacex-makes-and-donates-hand-sanitizer-face-shields-to-stop-covid-19.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">making hand sanitizer</a> to donate to <span>hospitals and other businesses</span>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Target’s </strong>same-store sales in the essentials and food & bev categories are <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/25/target-scales-back-store-remodels-and-openings-amid-coronavirus-outbreak.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up over 50%</a> in March.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>“There is no playbook for how to react in this environment,” CEO Brian Cornell said. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Boeing </strong>stock rose over 24% yesterday. No one blinked.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Pornhub </strong>has donated <a href="https://nypost.com/2020/03/24/pornhub-gives-nyc-coronavirus-workers-50k-masks-and-free-porn/?utm_source=NYPTwitter&utm_campaign=SocialFlow&utm_medium=SocialFlow&__twitter_impression=true&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">50,000 surgical masks</a> to frontline medical workers in the NYC area. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zero sports: </strong>Today was supposed to be Opening Day for the MLB and the beginning of the Sweet Sixteen for the NCAA Championship. Instead, Steph Curry is doing a <a href="https://www.nbcsports.com/bayarea/warriors/steph-curry-hold-coronavirus-qa-dr-anthony-fauci-instagram?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">coronavirus Q&A</a> with Dr. Fauci at 1pm ET. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Online book sales </strong>at Waterstones, the U.K.’s largest book chain, were <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/books/2020/mar/25/book-sales-surge-self-isolating-readers-bucket-list-novels?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up 400%</a> week-over-week. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This is the seven-day moving average </strong>of total flights tracked by Flightradar24. The dark blue is the year 2020.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/357/flightradar24_flights_march_2020.png" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="Flightradar24 Flights March 2020"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Flightradar24</em> </small></p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/26/morning-brews-march-reads?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brew's Bookshelf
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTIvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Every other Thursday, we’re bringing you a few of the Brew’s favorite, business-related reads.</em></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Tech:</strong></span><span><span> </span></span><span><a href="https://www.annawiener.com/uncanny-valley-1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Uncanny Valley</em></a></span><span><span> </span></span><span>is Anna Wiener’s memoir of leaving the publishing industry in 2013 to work in Silicon Valley. This was our March pick for the office book club, so join us for a wild ride through the tech startup craze. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Personal development:</strong></span><span><span> </span></span><span><a href="https://www.calnewport.com/books/deep-work/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Deep Work</em></a></span><span><span> </span></span><span>by Cal Newport teaches you how to hit distraction-free workflow zen. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Retail:</strong></span><span><span> </span></span><span><a href="http://www.danathomas.com/fashionopolis.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Fashionopolis</em></a></span><span><span> </span></span><span>is journalist Dana Thomas’s teardown of the fashion industry’s fraught relationship with sustainability. You won’t look at your jeans the same way after reading. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Have a suggestion for us?<span> </span><a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/O2tX0X?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Drop it here</a>. We’ll regularly feature some of our favorite reader recs.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/25/morning-brews-daily-quarantine-planner-march-26?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Your Daily Quarantine Planner: March 26
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Garfield wakes up Jim" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=503 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/356/garfield_wakes_up_jim.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Garfield wakes up Jim" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/356/garfield_wakes_up_jim.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You know Kinsey Grant's voice from <em>Business Casual</em>—now, pretend like she's reading her daily quarantine planner to you. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/weight-lifter_1f3cb.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Morning Workout</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Step 1: Get a <a href="https://thesculptsociety.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">14-day free trial</a> of The Sculpt Society’s cult favorite dance cardio workout. Step 2: Stop pretending like dance cardio isn’t fun.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/video-camera_1f4f9.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> New tech</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you wished you’d hugged your friends a little tighter before all this, check out the <a href="https://www.marcopolo.me/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Marco Polo</a> app. It’s the best of group chat, Snapchat, and chat chat for long-distance friendships.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/headphone_1f3a7.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Work playlists</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Stevie Nicks <a href="https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/9340869/stevie-nicks-called-harry-styles-fine-line-his-rumors?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">called</a> Harry Styles’s most recent album <a href="https://open.spotify.com/album/7xV2TzoaVc0ycW7fwBwAml?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Fine Line</em></a> his <em>Rumours</em>. There is no better endorsement.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/google/241/bento-box_1f371.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Lunch break, but make it productive</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Stay up to date:</strong></span><span> </span><span><a href="https://deezlinks.substack.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Deez Links</a></span><span> is a daily newsletter best described as “a mix of must-reads + general recommendations + TikToks.” I love it.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Do good: </strong></span><span>There's a desperate shortage medical supplies at hospitals around the world. The mission of the </span><span><a href="https://www.gofundme.com/f/frontlinerespondersfund?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Frontline Responders Fund</a></span><span> is to get those supplies into the hands of the workers who need them.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Level up:</strong></span><span> Your commute might have been cut down to 15 seconds, but podcasters have not stopped talking into microphones. I recommend </span><span><a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/meet-cute/id1491088065?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Meet Cute</em></a></span><span> for hopeless romantics, </span><span><em><a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/iditapod/id1204512892?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Iditapod</a></em></span><span> for sports fans missing sports, and Morning Brew’s </span><span><em><a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/business-casual/id1480059697?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Business Casual</a></em></span><span> for everyone else.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/canned-food_1f96b.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Dinner plans</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Make whatever <a href="https://www.instagram.com/mollybaz/?hl=en&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Molly Baz</a> is making. She and the Bon Appétit test kitchen crew make “use whatever’s in the pantry” look like 3 Michelin stars. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/television_1f4fa.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Evening activities</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">No screen:</strong> <a href="https://www.goodknitkisses.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Learn to knit</a>. It’s relaxing, unless you’re like me and make it a competition for who in your quarantine group can finish a scarf the fastest. Either way, you get a scarf.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Screen: </strong>Watch Netflix’s <em>Tiger King</em> for a <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2020/mar/20/tiger-king-joe-exotic-netflix-series?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">thrilling story</a>. Then, consider buying online from an artist—one of my favorites, <a href="https://sarah-bahbah.myshopify.com/collections/bonjour-bitch?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sarah Bahbah</a>, is doing BOGO prints so you can give one to someone who may need some art therapy right now.</p>
<hr>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/house-with-garden_1f3e1.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">We want you to live your best quarantined life</strong>—so much so, that we launched a brand new, free newsletter to be your guide. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/the-essentials/?utm_medium=onsite&utm_campaign=dailyplanner_032020&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out The Essentials→</a></em></p>

QUARANTINE TRIVIA
</h3>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Which of the following is the true origin of the word “quarantine”? </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In the 14th century, ships coming into Venice from infected ports had to wait 40 days before landing. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The traditional dwellings in Benedictine monasteries in France. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A designated section of Civil War camps for the wounded. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The room where the high priest would wait before entering the Holy of Holies in First Temple-era Jerusalem. </span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Answer at the bottom.</p>
</td>
</tr>

That number is expected to crush previous records. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eU.S. markets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWall Street posted its first \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks/sp-500-rallies-for-second-day-as-investors-await-economic-aid-package-idUSKBN21C18U?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eback-to-back gains\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since February. width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNjAvY2FwaXRvbF9oaWxsLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eALEX EDELMAN/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter two false starts and some last-minute political squabbling, the Senate passed a $2 trillion economic relief package late last night. Combined with \u003cspan\u003eFed intervention\u003c/span\u003e, total stimulus measures add up to $6 trillion, according to White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWrite down what you did today \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis is a historic moment; the \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-administration-senate-democrats-said-to-reach-stimulus-bill-deal-11585113371?mod=hp_lead_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elargest stimulus measure ever approved by Congress\u003c/a\u003e could pass. This bill’s price tag is \u003cspan\u003emore than 30% larger than\u003c/span\u003e that of the legislation passed in the aftermath of the 2008 financial crisis. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet's break down the highlights: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e$301 billion of free money. \u003c/strong\u003eMany Americans will receive direct payments of up to $1,200, plus $500 per child. The payments phase out at individuals making more than $99,000 and couples making more than $198,000. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e$250 billion for expanded unemployment insurance. \u003c/strong\u003eThose who qualify for unemployment support will receive, on average, \u003cspan\u003eexpanded unemployment benefits for up to four months\u003c/span\u003e plus $600/week in addition to state benefits (this was the subject of the squabbling). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e$117 billion for hospitals and veterans' health care. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e$349 billion in loans to small businesses. \u003c/strong\u003eWhat you spend on payroll, utilities, or rent doesn't have to be repaid. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e$500 billion in loans, loan guarantees, or investments \u003c/strong\u003eavailable for companies, municipalities, and states that've been harmed. $61 billion is earmarked for loans\u003cspan\u003e and direct cash assistance\u003c/span\u003e to airlines—with strings attached like caps on executive pay and requirements that they maintain payroll. Another $17 billion is reserved for companies critical to national security. Lawmakers said that could apply to any number of firms...but we’re thinking of one planemaker that rhymes with “Froeing.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAll businesses that receive government loans are subject to restrictions like a ban on stock buybacks for the duration of the loan plus one year after. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAs for student loans...\u003c/strong\u003emost Americans with federal student loans won't need to make monthly payments through Sept. 30, with no interest accruing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe urgent nature of this crisis means the legislation is focused on what \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/25/business/2-trillion-stimulus-coronavirus-bill.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe NYT calls\u003c/a\u003e “survival payments.” The goal is to keep people employed and spending cash, as well as to extend a life raft to floundering companies. But if the coronavirus outbreak in the U.S. keeps chugging into the summer, even more government injections will probably be needed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGetting a haircut in the Petare slum of Caracas, Venezuela. Carlos Becerra/Getty Images.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe coronavirus pandemic has wrecked economies and buckled healthcare systems in the wealthiest nations in the world. Now, the virus is starting to spread across the world’s poorest countries, and the outlook is even more dire. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSocial distancing: \u003c/strong\u003eNearly 60% of Africa’s urban residents live in \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-is-advancing-on-poor-nations-and-the-prognosis-is-troubling-11585149183?mod=hp_lead_pos10\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecrowded slums\u003c/a\u003e, where basic sanitation practices like hand-washing aren’t available even in non-pandemic times. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTesting: \u003c/strong\u003eMany developing countries don’t have nearly enough testing capacity to determine whether they even have an outbreak. Indonesia (pop. ~273 million) tested just 7.4 people per million as of March 20, per \u003ca href=\"https://ourworldindata.org/covid-testing?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eOur World in Data\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eInformal economies: \u003c/strong\u003eThe vast majority of Indian workers participate in an “\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/25/coronavirus-india-lockdown-to-disproportionately-hurt-informal-sector.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einformal\u003c/a\u003e” economy composed of food vendors, taxi drivers, and other sidewalk businesses. As the country of 1.3+ billion goes into lockdown mode for 21 days, \u003cspan\u003epotential government handouts will be those workers' only source of income.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFormal economies: \u003c/strong\u003eAs investors duck for cover in U.S. government bonds, they’re \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/24/business/coronavirus-per-country-pandemic.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epulling money\u003c/a\u003e from emerging markets like South Africa and Brazil at the fastest pace on record.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOr at least it feels that long. As the world focuses on more pressing issues, Big Tech has gotten a break as D.C.'s punching bag—and with that a possible \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-big-tech/coronavirus-pandemic-hands-big-tech-a-chance-to-burnish-its-image-idUSKBN21442S?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eimage refresh\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe reasoning? \u003c/strong\u003eThere’s little time to talk monopolistic behavior or data privacy in the midst of a global health crisis and likely recession. Plus, Big Tech has been busy \u003ca href=\"http://wsj.com/articles/techs-next-disruption-target-the-coronavirus-11585147772?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisrupting disease\u003c/a\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAlphabet sicced its DeepMind AI arm on finding a COVID-19 vaccine.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFacebook is donating 720,000 masks to health workers and giving $100 million in cash and ad credits to small businesses.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCloud giants Amazon, Google, and Microsoft are joining President Trump’s COVID-19 High Performance Computing Consortium.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut...there’s a but.\u003c/strong\u003e Some wonder if Big Tech can \u003ca href=\"https://www.statnews.com/2020/03/25/tech-companies-coronavirus-response/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003escale efforts\u003c/a\u003e beyond the West Coast fast enough, especially as their services (connecting people on the internet, peddling Lysol wipes, feeding you dog videos) are more in demand now than ever. Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg may have put it best to the NYT: “We’re just trying to \u003ca collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you thought times were tough without a href=\"https://www.baltimoresun.com/coronavirus/bs-md-farmers-coronavirus-20200320-7yajictydjg27j6zgphqw32o2i-story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOn one hand, many supply one of the few “essential” businesses still open: grocery stores. But on the other, farms’ alternate buyers, restaurants, are \u003c/span\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/24/dining/restaurant-suppliers-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edramatically scaling back\u003c/a\u003e their purchasing\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe main issue: Small farms looking to pivot from dwindling restaurant business → booming grocery business lack the scale of competitors like Tyson or ConAgra.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLand-based farm operations \u003ca href=\"https://www.seattletimes.com/life/food-drink/can-seattles-farmers-markets-remain-open-through-the-stay-at-home-period/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erely on early spring income\u003c/a\u003e to fund seed purchases and upcoming planting, meaning a slowdown today hamstrings tomorrow's crop. All in all, the coronavirus pandemic could cost local and regional food systems $689 million in lost sales from March to May.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne creative workaround: \u003c/strong\u003eSome farmers are playing Amazon Fresh, \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-usa-farmers/who-needs-instacart-u-s-farmers-expand-food-deliveries-during-coronavirus-outbreak-idUSKBN21C1D3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eReuters reports\u003c/a\u003e.
